abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Transport Sector Project
            for Central African Republic were as follows: outcomes were
            unsatisfactory, project sustainability was uncertain, Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            also satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: the
            Borrower's capacity to absorb reforms should be
            estimated more carefully: it is no use to build a project
            with impressive objectives if these objectives cannot be
            achieved. Objectives should be limited in number, simple and
            consistent, and formulated in similar terms in all
            documents, and implementation timetables should be
            realistic. Special attention should be paid to sustaining
            internalization of sector reforms when frequent changes of
            staff in the administration occur. Legal work should be more
            substantial in preparation, appraisal, and operations and
            follow-up. Especially with regard to the relation to be
            established and maintained, through adequate legal
            arrangements, between the strategy letter and the work plan
            for project execution.
